intro: Tetracera sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran tetracera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
